jd_format.value:
Job Title

HR Business Partner

Overview

As an HR Business Partner at Humble Bridge, you will play a pivotal role in aligning our HR strategy with business objectives. You will be responsible for workforce planning, succession planning, leadership coaching, and labor relations. Your expertise will drive employee experience, organizational design, and change management initiatives.

Company Overview

Humble Bridge is a leading AI/ML company dedicated to driving digital transformation across various industries. We are committed to innovation, excellence, and creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with business objectives.
  • Conduct workforce planning and succession planning.
  • Provide leadership coaching and support.
  • Manage labor relations and ensure compliance with Austrian labor law.
  • Enhance employee experience through engagement initiatives.
  • Design and implement organizational change management strategies.
  • Collaborate with management to improve work relationships and productivity.
  • Analyze trends and metrics to develop HR solutions.
  • Support recruitment and talent acquisition processes.
  • Facilitate performance management and employee development programs.
  • Address employee grievances and provide appropriate solutions.
  • Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.
  • Partner with leadership to develop and implement HR policies.
  • Conduct training sessions and workshops for employees.
  • Manage HR projects and initiatives.
  • Support diversity and inclusion efforts.
  • Maintain HR systems and records.
  • Provide guidance on HR-related issues.
  • Foster a positive work environment.
  • Promote company values and culture.

Secondary Tasks

  • Assist in the development of HR policies and procedures.
  • Support the HR team in various administrative tasks.
  • Participate in HR audits and compliance reviews.

Requirements

Basic Qualification

  • Degree in Business Administration, Psychology, International Cultural and Business Studies, or related field.

Preferred Qualification

  • Advanced degree in HR or related field is a plus.

Experience

  • 5 years of experience.

License and Certificates

  • HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is preferred.

Language

  • Fluent in English (business), conversational in German.

Work Authorization

  • Must have legal authorization to work in Austria.

Skills

Must-have Skills

Technical Skills
  • HR strategy development
  • Workforce planning
  • Succession planning
  • Leadership coaching
  • Labor relations
  • Employee experience enhancement
  • Organizational design
  • Change management
  • General knowledge of HR practices
  • Familiarity with Austrian labor law
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and/or Google Workspace
Soft Skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Problem-solving and decision-making abilities
  • Ability to work collaboratively
  • Adaptability and flexibility
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Leadership and team management
  • Conflict resolution skills
  • Empathy and emotional intelligence
  • Strategic thinking
  • Attention to detail

Nice-to-have Skills

Technical Skills (Preferred)
  • Experience with HRIS systems
  • Knowledge of data analysis and reporting
Soft Skills (Preferred)
  • Innovative thinking
  • Ability to influence and negotiate

Compensation and Benefits

Compensation

Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.

Supplement Pay

Performance-based bonuses.

Benefits

Comprehensive health insurance, paid time off, and retirement plans.

We Offer

Opportunities for professional growth and development in a dynamic and innovative environment.

Entry

Immediate availability preferred.

Company Info

Call-To-Action

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter.

Address

Humble Bridge, Vienna, Austria

Application Instructions

Please submit your application through our careers page or email it to hr@humblebridge.com.

Reporting Line

Reports to the Director of Human Resources.

Measures of Outcome

Success in this role will be measured by employee satisfaction, retention rates, and the successful implementation of HR initiatives.

Work Environment

Work Schedule

Standard business hours with flexibility as needed.

Travel

Minimal travel required.

Job Type

Full-time

Location

Vienna, Austria

Employment Type

Permanent

Physical Demands

Primarily a desk-based role with occasional meetings.

No. of Openings

1

Industry Type

AI/ML

Department

Human Resources

Application Deadline

2023-11-15

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

Humble Bridge is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Diversity and Inclusion Statement

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued and respected.

Interview Rounds

The interview process includes an initial phone screening, followed by two rounds of interviews with HR and department leadership.

Level

Mid-level

suggestions.label: Requirement
values: Minimum of 5 years of experience in human resources management.
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
Proven track record of implementing HR strategies that align with business goals.
Strong understanding of labor laws and regulations.
Experience in managing employee relations and conflict resolution.
Ability to develop and implement HR policies and procedures.
Proficiency in HRIS and other HR-related software.
Experience in talent acquisition and recruitment processes.
Ability to analyze HR metrics and provide actionable insights.
Strong project management skills.
Experience in performance management and employee development.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Experience in organizational development and change management.
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Experience in compensation and benefits administration.
Ability to lead and manage HR projects from inception to completion.
Experience in diversity and inclusion initiatives.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

suggestions.label: Responsibilities
values: Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues.
Manage the recruitment and selection process.
Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital.
Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization.
Nurture a positive working environment.
Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance.
Maintain pay plan and benefits program.
Assess training needs to apply and monitor training programs.
Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics.
Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.
Develop and implement HR policies and procedures.
Manage and resolve complex employee relations issues.
Conduct effective, thorough, and objective investigations.
Provide HR policy guidance and interpretation.
Develop contract terms for new hires, promotions, and transfers.
Assist international employees with expatriate assignments and related HR matters.
Provide guidance and input on business unit restructures, workforce planning, and succession planning.
Identify training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs.
Participate in evaluation and monitoring of training programs to ensure success.
